2 Text: Preimage resistance, second preimage resistance, collision resistance.
Given h, hard to find m where H(m) = h.
Hard to find any m₁ ≠ m₂ where H(m₁) = H(m₂).
Finding collisions needs ~2^(n/2) work. SHA-256 has 128-bit collision resistance.

1 Text: Why not use H(K || m) for authentication?
2 Text: Length extension attack. Knowing H(K||m) allows computing H(K||m||padding||m').
